sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Brecht De Ruyte)
articles.description: It’s easy to get lost in a sea of CSS frameworks and libraries, each promising easier styling and smoother layouts. Brecht De Ruyte demonstrates four CSS utility classes (plus a bonus) using techniques that allow them to be used practically anywhere you need a particular layout — be it Grid or Flexbox — with configurable options.
articles.title: Modern CSS Layouts: You Might Not Need A Framework For That

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Should you hide or disable a feature? You’ve probably been there before. Here are some considerations for hiding versus disabling, along with possible alternatives to improve UX. An upcoming part of [Smart Interface Design Patterns](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com).
articles.title: Hidden vs. Disabled In UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Talke Hoppmann-Walton)
articles.description: Many organizations prioritize internal structures and services over customer-centricity, hindering effective decision-making. Through a case study, Talke Hoppmann-Walton advocates for a shift towards an outside-in perspective and proposes the use of a user segmentation matrix to foster alignment across departments and prioritize customer needs.
articles.title: Building A User Segmentation Matrix To Foster Cross-Org Alignment

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: Juan Diego Rodriguez explains why media queries still occupy a vital role in responsive layouts; only they are now one tool in a larger toolbox with modern techniques that are best when used together.
articles.title: Beyond CSS Media Queries

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Chris Day)
articles.description: Is there such a thing as harmony between designers and developers in the workplace, and if so, how can it be achieved? In this article, Chris Day explores the challenges of effective collaboration, outlines the key factors at play, and (hopefully!) empowers you to find the right solutions to help you and your team deliver to their full potential.
articles.title: Transforming The Relationship Between Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How do we conduct UX research when there is no or only limited access to users? Here are some workarounds to run UX research or make a strong case for it. An upcoming part of [Smart Interface Design Patterns](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com).
articles.title: Why Designers Aren’t Understood

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: Preethi Sam walks through an example that demonstrates where custom properties are more suitable than variables while showcasing the greater freedom and flexibility that custom properties provide for designing complex, refined animations.
articles.title: The Times You Need A Custom @property Instead Of A CSS Variable

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: In this comprehensive guide, Temani Afif explores different techniques for creating common shapes with the smallest and most flexible code possible.
articles.title: The Modern Guide For Making CSS Shapes

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lazar Nikolov)
articles.description: React Server Components (RSCs) combine the best of client-side rendering, and author Lazar Nikolov thoroughly examines how we got here with a deep look at the impact that RSCs have on the page load timeline.
articles.title: The Forensics Of React Server Components (RSCs)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How do we conduct UX research when there is no or only limited access to users? Here are some workarounds to run UX research or make a strong case for it. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: How To Run UX Research Without Access To Users

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eduard Kuric)
articles.description: In this article, Eduard Kuric discusses mouse interaction data, what kind of magic can be done with it, and some of the hidden pitfalls to watch out for so you get a head start incorporating them in your solutions.
articles.title: How To Harness Mouse Interaction Data For Practical Machine Learning Solutions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Amit Sheen)
articles.description: Amit Sheen demonstrates using `:has()` to apply styles conditionally when a certain `` in a `` element is chosen by the user and how we gain even more conditional styling capabilities when chaining `:has()` with other pseudo-classes, such as `:not()` — no JavaScript necessary.
articles.title: Combining CSS :has() And HTML <select> For Greater Conditional Styling

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: May is almost here, so what better occasion could there be for some fresh and inspiring desktop wallpapers? Created with love by artists and designers from across the globe, the wallpapers in this post come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: Longing For May (2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yaakov Karda)
articles.description: Business acquisitions are common but often shrouded in mystery because they happen behind closed doors. In this article, Yaakov details the story of his company and the journey it took him on, shedding light on the process of selling a business and what he learned from the experience.
articles.title: Lessons Learned After Selling My Startup

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: Free-tier pricing is a common marketing strategy. “Free” gets people in the door and allows them to settle in and see how things work. But, as Juan Diego Rodriguez explains, the practice of free *tiers* is often conflated with free *trials*. And while the distinction may be nuanced, the consequences of sunsetting free-tier pricing may be huge.
articles.title: The End Of The Free Tier

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michele Williams)
articles.description: Conducting UX research that includes participants with a variety of disabilities is vital to building inclusive technology, but most prototypes used for testing are inaccessible. Rather than continuing to leave out feedback from disabled consumers, which ultimately leads to exclusive technology, researchers must get creative in their workarounds and be relentless in their efforts.
articles.title: Conducting Accessibility Research In An Inaccessible Ecosystem

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pratik Joglekar)
articles.description: This article illustrates how AI can be leveraged to build tools that can be inclusive with a little bit of an additional effort.
articles.title: Using AI For Neurodiversity And Building Inclusive Tools

articles.author: Sophia Iroegbu
articles.description: As a software developer or engineer, it's not enough to know how to build useful solutions – you must also ensure that they are secure. Prioritizing your users is crucial when developing and deploying your software because if users can't use your app, it becomes useless. In this guide, we
articles.title: How to Secure Your Django App – Best Practices and Code Examples

articles.author: Kunal Nalawade
articles.description: JavaScript is a widely used language in web development and powers interactive features of virtually every website out there. JavaScript makes it possible to create dynamic web pages and is very versatile. JavaScript remains one of the most in-demand programming languages in 2024. Many companies are looking for proficiency in
articles.title: The JavaScript Interview Prep Handbook – Essential Topics to Know + Code Examples

articles.author: Matéush
articles.description: You can only make your React app visually appealing to users with styling. That makes styling a fundamental aspect of building captivating user interfaces. With React's component-based architecture, there are a ton of options for styling. These include traditional CSS, utility-first approach, CSS-in-JS solutions, and more. In this article, we'll
articles.title: How to Style React Components

articles.author: Estefania Cassingena Navone
articles.description: An application programming interface (API) is software that acts as an intermediary, allowing two applications to communicate. This project will teach you how to develop an API step by step and connect it to a database. We just published a course on ...
articles.title: APIs with Node.js and Express – Course in Spanish for Beginners

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Fine-tuning is a process in machine learning that allows you to adapt pre-trained models to specific tasks or datasets, enhancing their performance and usability. We just posted a comprehensive course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will...
articles.title: Fine-Tuning LLM Models Course

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: We are just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will help you improve your skills with Supabase and Angular. In this course, you will learn how to build a real-time chat application. The course is perfect for anyone lookin...
articles.title: Create a Real Time Chat App with Supabase and Angular

articles.author: Tarif Kahn
articles.description: If you're a web developer, designer, or project manager, you're likely quite busy these days and have a lot on your plate.  This is partly because the number of websites is growing rapidly, with 71% of all businesses [https://www.forbes.com/advisor/business/software/website-statistics/] in the world having one. In fact, every three seconds
articles.title: How to Collaborate with Web Development Teams Using Productivity Tools

articles.author: oluwatobi Joshua
articles.description: We are in the era of transformative technology with several innovations springing up to improve service delivery and enhance customers’ satisfaction. More so is the introduction of microservices and other distributed systems into the software industry to revolutionize enterprise application development. Its introduction has helped to solve problems associated with
articles.title: How to Build Resilient Microservice Systems – SOLID Principles for Microservices

articles.author: Oluwatobi Sofela
articles.description: Classes let you privatize your data while providing users indirect access to it. It is an excellent way to prevent direct access to your constructor’s data. This handbook aims to show you exactly how classes work in JavaScript. We will also discuss class fields and the super keyword. Table of
articles.title: The JavaScript Class Handbook – Complete Guide to Class Fields and the Super Keyword

articles.author: BekahHW
articles.description: You might be wondering why you would want to become an open source maintainer.  Well, I can tell you from my own experience that you'll learn a lot, grow your network, and meet and collaborate with people you wouldn’t have the opportunity to otherwise.  It also helps you
articles.title: How to Become an Open Source Project Maintainer
